snippet: The children, ages 2 and 6 months at the time, were strapped in their car seats, the windows cracked open, while she attended a job interview.
abstract: Maricopa County Superior Court Commissioner Jeffrey Rueter sentences Arizona mother Shanesha Taylor to 18 years supervised probation for leaving her two young sons alone in hot car for hour while she attended job interview; Taylor garnered sympathy online after her arrest, which led to thousands of dollars in donations, but squandered good will by spending money on nonessential items.
lead_paragraph: The children, ages 2 and 6 months at the time, were strapped in their car seats, the windows cracked open, while she attended a job interview.

headline.main: 18 Years’ Probation for Arizona Woman Who Left Sons in Car
headline.print_headline: 18 Years’ Probation for Arizona Mother Who Left 2 Children in Hot Car for Hour
